filteredArticles.headline: What would it be like studying abroad, from home?: Fate of fall abroad remains uncertain
filteredArticles.abstract: Although Penn Abroad said it would announce the fate of fall study abroad programs by May 15, the decision for many programs has been delayed once again because of the COVID-19 pandemic.

filteredArticles.headline: Class of 2020 looks forward to in-person May 2021 commencement

filteredArticles.headline: SPEC returns Spring Fling to two-day format with concert on Friday night
filteredArticles.abstract: This year, the headliner concert will take place on Friday night, while the Fling festival, which features food, games, and student group performances, and will take place during the day on Saturday.

filteredArticles.headline: An Acme supermarket will officially replace The Fresh Grocer on 40th and Walnut streets
filteredArticles.abstract: Less than a week after news broke that the Fresh Grocer would close next month, Penn officials confirmed that they have signed a lease with Acme Markets to replace the Fresh Grocer's current location.

filteredArticles.headline: UA representative plans to lobby Du Bois to prioritize Black students in housing selection
